faq.q: Will my PNG images look pixelated after compression?
faq.a: No. Toolaze uses intelligent compression algorithms that preserve visual quality while reducing file size. The compression focuses on removing invisible data and optimizing the image structure rather than reducing resolution unnecessarily.

faq.q: Are my design assets uploaded to a server?
faq.a: No! All compression happens locally in your browser using JavaScript and Canvas API. Your PNG images never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy and security for your design work.

faq.q: What's the difference between PNG and JPG compression?
faq.a: PNG compression preserves transparency (Alpha channel) and is lossless, making it ideal for graphics with transparent backgrounds. JPG compression removes transparency and uses lossy compression, which is better for photographs but unsuitable for graphics requiring transparency.

faq.q: Can I use this for icons and logos?
faq.a: Absolutely! PNG compression to 100KB is perfect for icons, logos, and graphics that require transparency. The compression maintains sharp edges and transparent backgrounds, ensuring your branding assets look professional on any background.

content.title: JPG Compression Benefits
content.text: JPG (JPEG) is the most widely used image format for photos and web images. However, large JPG files can slow down websites, consume storage space, and cause upload failures. Compressing JPG images reduces file size by 50-70% while maintaining acceptable visual quality, making them perfect for web use, email attachments, and online forms. Our browser-based compressor processes your JPG files locally using Canvas API, ensuring complete privacy and fast compression without uploading your images to any server.

content.title: When to Compress JPG
content.text: Compress JPG images when you need to reduce file size for faster website loading, meet upload size limits for online forms or email attachments, save storage space on your device or cloud storage, or optimize images for social media platforms. Our tool supports precise size control, allowing you to set exact target sizes in KB or MB, making it perfect for meeting specific requirements while maintaining image quality.

Compressing PNG images reduces file size by 40-60% while preserving transparency and maintaining visual quality, making them perfect for web use without sacrificing the transparency features that make PNG valuable.

content.title: Batch Compression Benefits
content.text: Processing images one by one is time-consuming and inefficient. Batch compression allows you to compress up to 100 images simultaneously, saving hours of work and ensuring consistent results across your entire image collection. Whether you're optimizing a photo gallery, preparing images for a website, or compressing files for storage, batch processing handles everything in one operation. Our browser-based batch compressor processes all images locally using Canvas API, ensuring complete privacy while providing fast, efficient compression without uploading your images to any server.

content.title: When to Use Batch Compression
content.text: Use batch compression when you need to optimize entire photo galleries or image collections, prepare multiple images for website uploads or social media, compress files for storage or backup purposes, or process images with consistent compression settings. Our tool supports JPG, PNG, WebP, and BMP formats, allowing you to mix different formats in a single batch operation, making it perfect for handling diverse image collections efficiently.
